  832: 
  833: %% Tests arguments to erlang:system_monitor/0,1,2
  834: system_monitor_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  835:     Self = self(),
  836:     %%
  837:     OldMonitor = erlang:system_monitor(undefined),
  838:     undefined = erlang:system_monitor(Self, [{long_gc,0}]),
  839:     MinT = case erlang:system_monitor() of
  840:                {Self,[{long_gc,T}]} when is_integer(T), T > 0 -> T;
  841:                Other1 -> test_server:fault(Other1)
  842:            end,
  843:     {Self,[{long_gc,MinT}]} = erlang:system_monitor(),
  844:     {Self,[{long_gc,MinT}]} = 
  845:     erlang:system_monitor({Self,[{large_heap,0}]}),
  846:     MinN = case erlang:system_monitor() of
  847:                {Self,[{large_heap,N}]} when is_integer(N), N > 0 -> N;
  848:                Other2 -> test_server:fault(Other2)
  849:            end,
  850:     {Self,[{large_heap,MinN}]} = erlang:system_monitor(),
  851:     {Self,[{large_heap,MinN}]} = 
  852:     erlang:system_monitor(Self, [busy_port]),
  853:     {Self,[busy_port]} = erlang:system_monitor(),
  854:     {Self,[busy_port]} = 
  855:     erlang:system_monitor({Self,[busy_dist_port]}),
  856:     {Self,[busy_dist_port]} = erlang:system_monitor(),
  857:     All = lists:sort([busy_port,busy_dist_port,
  858:                       {long_gc,1},{large_heap,65535}]),
  859:     {Self,[busy_dist_port]} = erlang:system_monitor(Self, All),
  860:     {Self,A1} = erlang:system_monitor(),
  861:     All = lists:sort(A1),
  862:     {Self,A1} = erlang:system_monitor(Self, []),
  863:     Pid = spawn(fun () -> receive {Self,die} -> exit(die) end end),
  864:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  865:     undefined = erlang:system_monitor(Pid, All),
  866:     {Pid,A2} = erlang:system_monitor(),
  867:     All = lists:sort(A2),
  868:     Pid ! {Self,die},
  869:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok end,
  870:     undefined = erlang:system_monitor(OldMonitor),
  871:     erlang:yield(),
  872:     OldMonitor = erlang:system_monitor(),
  873:     %%
  874:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:system_monitor(atom)),
  875:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:system_monitor({})),
  876:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:system_monitor({1})),
  877:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:system_monitor({1,2,3})),
  878:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  879:     (catch erlang:system_monitor({Self,atom})),
  880:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  881:     (catch erlang:system_monitor(atom, atom)),
  882:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  883:     (catch erlang:system_monitor({Self,[busy_port|busy_dist_port]})),
  884:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  885:     (catch erlang:system_monitor(Self, [{long_gc,-1}])),
  886:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  887:     (catch erlang:system_monitor({Self,[{long_gc,atom}]})),
  888:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  889:     (catch erlang:system_monitor(Self,[{large_heap,-1}])),
  890:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = 
  891:     (catch erlang:system_monitor({Self,[{large_heap,atom}]})),
  892:     ok.
  893: 
  894: 
  895: %% Tests arguments to erlang:system_monitor/0,1,2
  896: more_system_monitor_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  897:     try_l(64000),
  898:     try_l(16#7ffffff),
  899:     try_l(16#3fffffff),
  900:     try_l(16#7fffffff),
  901:     try_l(16#ffffffff),
  902:     ok.
  903: 
  904: try_l(Val) ->
  905:     Self = self(),
  906:     Arbitrary1 = 77777,
  907:     Arbitrary2 = 88888,
  908: 
  909:     erlang:system_monitor(undefined),
  910: 
  911:     undefined = erlang:system_monitor(Self, [{long_gc,Val},{large_heap,Arbitrary1}]),
  912: 
  913:     {Self,Comb0} = erlang:system_monitor(Self, [{long_gc,Arbitrary2},{large_heap,Val}]),
  914:     [{large_heap,Arbitrary1},{long_gc,Val}] = lists:sort(Comb0),
  915: 
  916:     {Self,Comb1} = erlang:system_monitor(undefined),
  917:     [{large_heap,Val},{long_gc,Arbitrary2}] = lists:sort(Comb1).
  918: 
  919: monitor_sys(Parent) ->
  920:     receive 
  921:         {monitor,Pid,long_schedule,Data} when is_pid(Pid) -> 
  922:             io:format("Long schedule of ~w: ~w~n",[Pid,Data]),
  923:             Parent ! {Pid,Data},
  924:             monitor_sys(Parent);
  925:         {monitor,Port,long_schedule,Data} when is_port(Port) -> 
  926:             {name,Name} = erlang:port_info(Port,name),
  927:             io:format("Long schedule of ~w (~p): ~w~n",[Port,Name,Data]),
  928:             Parent ! {Port,Data},
  929:             monitor_sys(Parent);
  930:         Other ->
  931:             erlang:display(Other)
  932:     end.
  933: 
  934: start_monitor() ->
  935:     Parent = self(),
  936:     Mpid = spawn_link(fun() -> monitor_sys(Parent) end),
  937:     erlang:system_monitor(Mpid,[{long_schedule,100}]),
  938:     erlang:yield(), % Need to be rescheduled for the trace to take
  939:     ok.
  940: 
  941: %% Tests erlang:system_monitor(Pid, [{long_schedule,Time}])
  942: system_monitor_long_schedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  943:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  944:     erl_ddll:start(),
  945:     case (catch load_driver(Path, slow_drv)) of
  946:         ok ->
  947:             do_system_monitor_long_schedule();
  948:         _Error ->
  949:             {skip, "Unable to load slow_drv (windows or no usleep()?)"}
  950:     end.
  951: do_system_monitor_long_schedule() ->
  952:     start_monitor(),
  953:     Port = open_port({spawn_driver,slow_drv}, []),
  954:     "ok" = erlang:port_control(Port,0,[]),
  955:     Self = self(),
  956:     receive
  957:         {Self,L} when is_list(L) ->
  958:             ok
  959:     after 1000 ->
  960:             ct:fail(no_trace_of_pid)
  961:     end,
  962:     "ok" = erlang:port_control(Port,1,[]),
  963:     receive
  964:         {Port,LL} when is_list(LL) ->
  965:             ok
  966:     after 1000 ->
  967:             ct:fail(no_trace_of_port)
  968:     end,
  969:     port_close(Port),
  970:     erlang:system_monitor(undefined),
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: 
  974: -define(LONG_GC_SLEEP, 670).
  975: 
  976: %% Tests erlang:system_monitor(Pid, [{long_gc,Time}])
  977: system_monitor_long_gc_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  978:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  979:     try 
  980:         case erts_debug:get_internal_state(force_heap_frags) of
  981:             true ->
  982:                 {skip,"emulator with FORCE_HEAP_FRAGS defined"};
  983:             false ->
  984:                 %% Add ?LONG_GC_SLEEP ms to all gc
  985:                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(test_long_gc_sleep,
  986:                                               ?LONG_GC_SLEEP),
  987:                 LoadFun = fun () -> 
  988:                                   garbage_collect(),
  989:                                   self() 
  990:                           end,
  991:                 long_gc(LoadFun, false)
  992:         end
  993:     after
  994:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(test_long_gc_sleep, 0),
  995:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)	
  996:     end.
  997: 
  998: %% Tests erlang:system_monitor(Pid, [{long_gc,Time}])
  999: system_monitor_long_gc_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1000:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 1001:     try
 1002:         case erts_debug:get_internal_state(force_heap_frags) of
 1003:             true ->
 1004:                 {skip,"emulator with FORCE_HEAP_FRAGS defined"};
 1005:             false ->
 1006:                 %% Add ?LONG_GC_SLEEP ms to all gc
 1007:                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(test_long_gc_sleep,
 1008:                                               ?LONG_GC_SLEEP),
 1009:                 Parent = self(),
 1010:                 LoadFun =
 1011:                 fun () ->
 1012:                         Ref = make_ref(),
 1013:                         Pid = 
 1014:                         spawn_link(
 1015:                           fun () ->
 1016:                                   garbage_collect(),
 1017:                                   Parent ! {Ref, self()}
 1018:                           end),
 1019:                         receive {Ref, Pid} -> Pid end
 1020:                 end,
 1021:                 long_gc(LoadFun, true),
 1022:                 long_gc(LoadFun, true),
 1023:                 long_gc(LoadFun, true)
 1024:         end
 1025:     after
 1026:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(test_long_gc_sleep, 0),
 1027:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 1028:     end.
 1029: 
 1030: long_gc(LoadFun, ExpectMonMsg) ->
 1031:     Self = self(),
 1032:     Time = 1,
 1033:     OldMonitor = erlang:system_monitor(Self, [{long_gc,Time}]),
 1034:     Pid = LoadFun(),
 1035:     Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(Pid),
 1036:     receive {trace_delivered, Pid, Ref} -> ok end,
 1037:     {Self,[{long_gc,Time}]} = erlang:system_monitor(OldMonitor),
 1038:     case {long_gc_check(Pid, Time, undefined), ExpectMonMsg} of
 1039:         {ok, true} when Pid =/= Self ->
 1040:             ok;
 1041:         {ok, false} ->
 1042:             ct:fail(unexpected_system_monitor_message_received);
 1043:         {undefined, false} ->
 1044:             ok;
 1045:         {undefined, true} ->
 1046:             ct:fail(no_system_monitor_message_received)
 1047:     end.
 1048: 
 1049: long_gc_check(Pid, Time, Result) ->
 1050:     receive
 1051:         {monitor,Pid,long_gc,L} = Monitor ->
 1052:             case lists:foldl(
 1053:                    fun (_, error) ->
 1054:                            error;
 1055:                        ({timeout,T}, N) when is_integer(T),
 1056:                                              Time =< T, T =< 10*?LONG_GC_SLEEP ->
 1057:                            %% OTP-7622. The time T must be within reasonable limits
 1058:                            %% for the test to pass.
 1059:                            N-1;
 1060:                        ({heap_size,_}, N) ->
 1061:                            N-1;
 1062:                        ({old_heap_size,_}, N) ->
 1063:                            N-1;
 1064:                        ({stack_size,_}, N) ->
 1065:                            N-1;
 1066:                        ({mbuf_size,_}, N) ->
 1067:                            N-1;
 1068:                        ({heap_block_size,_}, N) ->
 1069:                            N-1;
 1070:                        ({old_heap_block_size,_}, N) ->
 1071:                            N-1;
 1072:                        (_, _) ->
 1073:                            error
 1074:                    end, 7, L) of
 1075:                 0 ->
 1076:                     long_gc_check(Pid, Time, ok);
 1077:                 error ->
 1078:                     {error,Monitor}
 1079:             end;
 1080:         {monitor,_,long_gc,_} ->
 1081:             long_gc_check(Pid, Time, Result);
 1082:         Other ->
 1083:             {error,Other}
 1084:     after 0 ->
 1085:               Result
 1086:     end.
 1087: 
 1088: %% Tests erlang:system_monitor(Pid, [{large_heap,Size}])
 1089: system_monitor_large_heap_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1090:     LoadFun =
 1091:     fun (Size) -> 
 1092:             List = seq(1,2*Size),
 1093:             garbage_collect(),
 1094:             true = lists:prefix([1], List),
 1095:             self() 
 1096:     end,
 1097:     large_heap(LoadFun, false).
 1098: 
 1099: %% Tests erlang:system_monitor(Pid, [{large_heap,Size}])
 1100: system_monitor_large_heap_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1101:     Parent = self(),
 1102:     LoadFun =
 1103:     fun (Size) ->
 1104:             Ref = make_ref(),
 1105:             Pid = 
 1106:             spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1107:                               garbage_collect(),
 1108:                               Parent ! {Ref, self()}
 1109:                       end,
 1110:                       [link, {min_heap_size, 2*Size}]),
 1111:             receive {Ref, Pid} -> Pid end
 1112:     end,
 1113:     large_heap(LoadFun, true).
 1114: 
 1115: large_heap(LoadFun, ExpectMonMsg) ->
 1116:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
 1117:     %%
 1118:     Size = 65535,
 1119:     Self = self(),
 1120:     NewMonitor = {Self,[{large_heap,Size}]},
 1121:     OldMonitor = erlang:system_monitor(NewMonitor),
 1122:     Pid = LoadFun(Size),
 1123:     Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(Pid),
 1124:     receive {trace_delivered, Pid, Ref} -> ok end,
 1125:     {Self,[{large_heap,Size}]} = erlang:system_monitor(OldMonitor),
 1126:     case {large_heap_check(Pid, Size, undefined), ExpectMonMsg} of
 1127:         {ok, true} when Pid =/= Self ->
 1128:             ok;
 1129:         {ok, false} ->
 1130:             ct:fail(unexpected_system_monitor_message_received);
 1131:         {undefined, false} ->
 1132:             ok;
 1133:         {undefined, true} ->
 1134:             ct:fail(no_system_monitor_message_received)
 1135:     end,
 1136:     ok.
 1137: 
 1138: large_heap_check(Pid, Size, Result) ->
 1139:     receive
 1140:         {monitor,Pid,large_heap,L} = Monitor ->
 1141:             case lists:foldl(
 1142:                    fun (_, error) ->
 1143:                            error;
 1144:                        ({heap_size,_}, N) ->
 1145:                            N-1;
 1146:                        ({old_heap_size,_}, N) ->
 1147:                            N-1;
 1148:                        ({stack_size,_}, N) ->
 1149:                            N-1;
 1150:                        ({mbuf_size,_}, N) ->
 1151:                            N-1;
 1152:                        ({heap_block_size,_}, N) ->
 1153:                            N-1;
 1154:                        ({old_heap_block_size,_}, N) ->
 1155:                            N-1;
 1156:                        (_, _) ->
 1157:                            error
 1158:                    end, 6, L) of
 1159:                 0 ->
 1160:                     large_heap_check(Pid, Size, ok);
 1161:                 error ->
 1162:                     {error,Monitor}
 1163:             end;
 1164:         {monitor,_,large_heap,_} ->
 1165:             large_heap_check(Pid, Size, Result);
 1166:         Other ->
 1167:             {error,Other}
 1168:     after 0 ->
 1169:               Result
 1170:     end.
 1171: 
 1172: seq(N, M) ->
 1173:     seq(N, M, []).
 1174: 
 1175: seq(M, M, R) ->
 1176:     lists:reverse(R);
 1177: seq(N, M, R) ->
 1178:     seq(N+1, M, [N|R]).
 1179: 
 1180: 
 1181: is_send_traced(Pid, Listener, Msg) ->
 1182:     Pid ! {send_please, Listener, Msg},
 1183:     receive
 1184:         Any ->
 1185:             {trace, Pid, send, Msg, Listener} = Any,
 1186:             true
 1187:     after 1000 ->
 1188:               false
 1189:     end.
 1190: 
 1191: %% This procedure assumes that the Parent process is send traced.
 1192: 
 1193: spawn_children(Parent, Number) ->
 1194:     spawn_children(Parent, Number, []).
 1195: 
 1196: spawn_children(_Parent, 0, Result) ->
 1197:     lists:reverse(Result);
 1198: spawn_children(Parent, Number, Result) ->
 1199:     Self = self(),
 1200:     Parent ! {spawn_please, Self, fun process/0},
 1201:     Child = 
 1202:     receive
 1203:         {trace, Parent, send, {spawned, Pid}, Self} -> Pid
 1204:     end,
 1205:     receive
 1206:         {spawned, Child} ->
 1207:             spawn_children(Parent, Number-1, [Child|Result])
 1208:     end.
 1209: 
 1210: %% Test erlang:suspend/1 and erlang:resume/1.
 1211: suspend(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1212:     ct:timetrap({minutes,2}),
 1213:     Worker = fun_spawn(fun worker/0),
 1214:     %% Suspend a process and test that it is suspended.
 1215:     ok = do_suspend(Worker, 10000),
 1216:     ok.
 1217: 
 1218: do_suspend(_Pid, 0) ->
 1219:     ok;
 1220: do_suspend(Pid, N) ->
 1221:     %% Suspend a process and test that it is suspended.
 1222:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
 1223:     {status, suspended} = process_info(Pid, status),
 1224: 
 1225:     %% Unsuspend the process and make sure it starts working.
 1226:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
 1227:     case process_info(Pid, status) of
 1228:         {status, runnable} -> ok;
 1229:         {status, running} -> ok;
 1230:         {status, garbage_collecting} -> ok;
 1231:         ST -> ct:fail(ST)
 1232:     end,
 1233:     erlang:yield(),
 1234:     do_suspend(Pid, N-1).
 1235: 
 1236: suspend_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1237:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 1238:     rand:seed(exsplus, {4711,17,4711}),
 1239:     do_suspend_exit(5000),
 1240:     ok.
 1241: 
 1242: do_suspend_exit(0) ->
 1243:     ok;
 1244: do_suspend_exit(N) ->
 1245:     Work = rand:uniform(50),
 1246:     Parent = self(),
 1247:     {Suspendee, Mon2}
 1248:     = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1249:                             suspend_exit_work(Work),
 1250:                             exit(normal)
 1251:                     end),
 1252:     {Suspender, Mon1}
 1253:     = spawn_monitor(
 1254:         fun () ->
 1255:                 suspend_exit_work(Work div 2),
 1256:                 Parent ! {doing_suspend, self()},
 1257:                 case catch erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee) of
 1258:                     {'EXIT', _} ->
 1259:                         ok;
 1260:                     true ->
 1261:                         erlang:resume_process(Suspendee)
 1262:                 end
 1263:         end),
 1264:     receive
 1265:         {doing_suspend, Suspender} ->
 1266:             case N rem 2 of
 1267:                 0 -> exit(Suspender, bang);
 1268:                 1 -> ok
 1269:             end
 1270:     end,
 1271:     receive {'DOWN', Mon1, process, Suspender, _} -> ok end,
 1272:     receive {'DOWN', Mon2, process, Suspendee, _} -> ok end,
 1273:     do_suspend_exit(N-1).
 1274: 
 1275: 
 1276: 
 1277: 
 1278: suspend_exit_work(0) ->
 1279:     ok;
 1280: suspend_exit_work(N) ->
 1281:     process_info(self()),
 1282:     suspend_exit_work(N-1).
 1283: 
 1284: -define(CHK_SUSPENDED(P,B), chk_suspended(P, B, ?LINE)).
 1285: 
 1286: chk_suspended(P, Bool, Line) ->
 1287:     {Bool, Line} = {({status, suspended} == process_info(P, status)), Line}.
 1288: 
 1289: suspender_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1290:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 3}),
 1291:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1292:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:resume_process(P1)),
 1293:     {P2, M2} = spawn_monitor(
 1294:                  fun () ->
 1295:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, false),
 1296:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1297:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1298:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1299:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1300:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1301:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1302:                          erlang:resume_process(P1),
 1303:                          erlang:resume_process(P1),
 1304:                          erlang:resume_process(P1),
 1305:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1306:                          erlang:resume_process(P1),
 1307:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, false),
 1308:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1309:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1310:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1311:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1312:                          exit(bang)
 1313:                  end),
 1314:     receive
 1315:         {'DOWN', M2,process,P2,R2} ->
 1316:             bang = R2,
 1317:             ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, false)
 1318:     end,
 1319:     Parent = self(),
 1320:     {P3, M3} = spawn_monitor(
 1321:                  fun () ->
 1322:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1323:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1324:                          Parent ! self(),
 1325:                          receive after infinity -> ok end
 1326:                  end),
 1327:     {P4, M4} = spawn_monitor(
 1328:                  fun () ->
 1329:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1330:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1331:                          Parent ! self(),
 1332:                          receive after infinity -> ok end
 1333:                  end),
 1334:     {P5, M5} = spawn_monitor(
 1335:                  fun () ->
 1336:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1337:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1338:                          Parent ! self(),
 1339:                          receive after infinity -> ok end
 1340:                  end),
 1341:     {P6, M6} = spawn_monitor(
 1342:                  fun () ->
 1343:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1344:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1345:                          Parent ! self(),
 1346:                          receive after infinity -> ok end
 1347:                  end),
 1348:     {P7, M7} = spawn_monitor(
 1349:                  fun () ->
 1350:                          erlang:suspend_process(P1),
 1351:                          ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1352:                          Parent ! self(),
 1353:                          receive after infinity -> ok end
 1354:                  end),
 1355:     receive P3 -> ok end,
 1356:     receive P4 -> ok end,
 1357:     receive P5 -> ok end,
 1358:     receive P6 -> ok end,
 1359:     receive P7 -> ok end,
 1360:     ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true),
 1361:     exit(P3, bang),
 1362:     receive
 1363:         {'DOWN',M3,process,P3,R3} ->
 1364:             bang = R3,
 1365:             ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true)
 1366:     end,
 1367:     exit(P4, bang),
 1368:     receive
 1369:         {'DOWN',M4,process,P4,R4} ->
 1370:             bang = R4,
 1371:             ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true)
 1372:     end,
 1373:     exit(P5, bang),
 1374:     receive
 1375:         {'DOWN',M5,process,P5,R5} ->
 1376:             bang = R5,
 1377:             ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true)
 1378:     end,
 1379:     exit(P6, bang),
 1380:     receive
 1381:         {'DOWN',M6,process,P6,R6} ->
 1382:             bang = R6,
 1383:             ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, true)
 1384:     end,
 1385:     exit(P7, bang),
 1386:     receive
 1387:         {'DOWN',M7,process,P7,R7} ->
 1388:             bang = R7,
 1389:             ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P1, false)
 1390:     end,
 1391:     unlink(P1),
 1392:     exit(P1, bong),
 1393:     ok.
 1394: 
 1395: suspend_system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1396:     case os:getenv("ERL_EXTREME_TESTING") of
 1397:         "true" ->
 1398:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 3*60}),
 1399:             P = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1400:             suspend_until_system_limit(P),
 1401:             unlink(P),
 1402:             exit(P, bye),
 1403:             ok;
 1404:         _ ->
 1405:             {skip, "Takes too long time for normal testing"}
 1406:     end.
 1407: 
 1408: suspend_until_system_limit(P) ->
 1409:     suspend_until_system_limit(P, 0, 0).
 1410: 
 1411: suspend_until_system_limit(P, N, M) ->
 1412:     NewM = case M of
 1413:                1 ->
 1414:                    ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P, true), 2;
 1415:                1000000 ->
 1416:                    erlang:display(N), 1;
 1417:                _ ->
 1418:                    M+1
 1419:            end,
 1420:     case catch erlang:suspend_process(P) of
 1421:         true ->
 1422:             suspend_until_system_limit(P, N+1, NewM);
 1423:         {'EXIT', R} when R == system_limit;
 1424:                          element(1, R) == system_limit ->
 1425:             io:format("system limit at ~p~n", [N]),
 1426:             resume_from_system_limit(P, N, 0);
 1427:         Error ->
 1428:             ct:fail(Error)
 1429:     end.
 1430: 
 1431: resume_from_system_limit(P, 0, _) ->
 1432:     ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P, false),
 1433:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:resume_process(P)),
 1434:     ok;
 1435: resume_from_system_limit(P, N, M) ->
 1436:     NewM = case M of
 1437:                1 ->
 1438:                    ?CHK_SUSPENDED(P, true), 2;
 1439:                1000000 ->
 1440:                    erlang:display(N), 1;
 1441:                _ ->
 1442:                    M+1
 1443:            end,
 1444:     erlang:resume_process(P),
 1445:     resume_from_system_limit(P, N-1, NewM).
 1446: 
 1447: -record(susp_info, {async = 0,
 1448:                     dbl_async = 0,
 1449:                     synced = 0,
 1450:                     async_once = 0}).
 1451: 
 1452: suspend_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1453:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 3}),
 1454:     Self = self(),
 1455:     wait_for_empty_runq(10),
 1456:     Tok = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1457:                              Self ! self(),
 1458:                              tok_trace_loop(Self, 0, 1000000000)
 1459:                      end),
 1460:     TC = 1000,
 1461:     receive Tok -> ok end,
 1462:     SF = fun (N, #susp_info {async = A,
 1463:                              dbl_async = AA,
 1464:                              synced = S,
 1465:                              async_once = AO} = Acc) ->
 1466:                  Tag = {make_ref(), self()},
 1467:                  erlang:suspend_process(Tok, [{asynchronous, Tag}]),
 1468:                  Res = case {suspend_count(Tok), N rem 4} of
 1469:                            {0, 2} ->
 1470:                                erlang:suspend_process(Tok,
 1471:                                                       [asynchronous]),
 1472:                                case suspend_count(Tok) of
 1473:                                    2 ->
 1474:                                        erlang:resume_process(Tok),
 1475:                                        Acc#susp_info{async = A+1};
 1476:                                    0 ->
 1477:                                        erlang:resume_process(Tok),
 1478:                                        Acc#susp_info{async = A+1,
 1479:                                                      dbl_async = AA+1}
 1480:                                end;
 1481:                            {0, 1} ->
 1482:                                erlang:suspend_process(Tok,
 1483:                                                       [asynchronous,
 1484:                                                        unless_suspending]),
 1485:                                case suspend_count(Tok) of
 1486:                                    1 ->
 1487:                                        Acc#susp_info{async = A+1};
 1488:                                    0 ->
 1489:                                        Acc#susp_info{async = A+1,
 1490:                                                      async_once = AO+1}
 1491:                                end;
 1492:                            {0, 0} ->
 1493:                                erlang:suspend_process(Tok,
 1494:                                                       [unless_suspending]),
 1495:                                1 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1496:                                Acc#susp_info{async = A+1,
 1497:                                              synced = S+1};
 1498:                            {0, _} ->
 1499:                                Acc#susp_info{async = A+1};
 1500:                            _ ->
 1501:                                Acc
 1502:                        end,
 1503:                  receive
 1504:                      {Tag, Result} ->
 1505:                          suspended = Result,
 1506:                          erlang:resume_process(Tok)
 1507:                  end,
 1508:                  erlang:yield(),
 1509:                  Res
 1510:          end,
 1511:     SI = repeat_acc(SF, TC, #susp_info{}),
 1512:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok, [asynchronous]),
 1513:     %% Verify that it eventually suspends
 1514:     WaitTime0 = 10,
 1515:     WaitTime1 = case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 1516:                       erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 1517:                     {false, false} ->
 1518:                         WaitTime0;
 1519:                     {false, true} ->
 1520:                         WaitTime0*5;
 1521:                     _ ->
 1522:                         WaitTime0*10
 1523:                 end,
 1524:     WaitTime = case {erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 1525:                      erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 1526:                    {Schdlrs, CPUs} when is_integer(CPUs),
 1527:                                         Schdlrs =< CPUs ->
 1528:                        WaitTime1;
 1529:                    _ ->
 1530:                        WaitTime1*10
 1531:                end,
 1532:     receive after WaitTime -> ok end,
 1533:     1 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1534:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok, [asynchronous]),
 1535:     2 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1536:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok, [asynchronous]),
 1537:     3 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1538:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok),
 1539:     4 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1540:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok),
 1541:     5 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1542:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok, [unless_suspending]),
 1543:     5 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1544:     erlang:suspend_process(Tok, [unless_suspending,
 1545:                                  asynchronous]),
 1546:     5 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1547:     erlang:resume_process(Tok),
 1548:     erlang:resume_process(Tok),
 1549:     erlang:resume_process(Tok),
 1550:     erlang:resume_process(Tok),
 1551:     1 = suspend_count(Tok),
 1552:     io:format("Main suspends: ~p~n"
 1553:               "Main async: ~p~n"
 1554:               "Double async: ~p~n"
 1555:               "Async once: ~p~n"
 1556:               "Synced: ~p~n",
 1557:               [TC,
 1558:                SI#susp_info.async,
 1559:                SI#susp_info.dbl_async,
 1560:                SI#susp_info.async_once,
 1561:                SI#susp_info.synced]),
 1562:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1563:         1 ->
 1564:             ok;
 1565:         _ ->
 1566:             true = SI#susp_info.async =/= 0
 1567:     end,
 1568:     unlink(Tok),
 1569:     exit(Tok, bang),
 1570:     ok.
 1571: 
 1572: suspend_count(Suspendee) ->
 1573:     suspend_count(self(), Suspendee).
 1574: 
 1575: suspend_count(Suspender, Suspendee) ->
 1576:     {suspending, SList} = process_info(Suspender, suspending),
 1577: 
 1578:     case lists:keysearch(Suspendee, 1, SList) of
 1579:         {value, {_Suspendee, 0, 0}} ->
 1580:             ct:fail({bad_suspendee_list, SList});
 1581:         {value, {Suspendee, Count, 0}} when is_integer(Count), Count > 0 ->
 1582:             {status, suspended} = process_info(Suspendee, status),
 1583:             Count;
 1584:         {value, {Suspendee, 0, Outstanding}} when is_integer(Outstanding),
 1585:                                                   Outstanding > 0 ->
 1586:             0;
 1587:         false ->
 1588:             0;
 1589:         Error ->
 1590:             ct:fail({bad_suspendee_list, Error, SList})
 1591:     end.
 1592: 
 1593: repeat_acc(Fun, N, Acc) ->
 1594:     repeat_acc(Fun, 0, N, Acc).
 1595: 
 1596: repeat_acc(_Fun, N, N, Acc) ->
 1597:     Acc;
 1598: repeat_acc(Fun, N, M, Acc) ->
 1599:     repeat_acc(Fun, N+1, M, Fun(N, Acc)).
 1600: 
 1601: %% Tests that waiting process can be suspended
 1602: %% (bug in R2D and earlier; see OTP-1488).
 1603: 
 1604: %% Test that a waiting process can be suspended.
 1605: suspend_waiting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1606:     Process = fun_spawn(fun process/0),
 1607:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1608:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Process),
 1609:     {status, suspended} = process_info(Process, status),
 1610:     ok.
 1611: 
 1612: 
 1613: %% Test that erlang:trace(new, true, ...) is cleared when tracer dies.
 1614: new_clear(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1615:     Tracer = proplists:get_value(receiver, Config),
 1616: 
 1617:     0 = erlang:trace(new, true, [send, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1618:     {flags, [send]} = erlang:trace_info(new, flags),
 1619:     {tracer, Tracer} = erlang:trace_info(new, tracer),
 1620:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Tracer),
 1621:     true = exit(Tracer, done),
 1622:     receive
 1623:         {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok
 1624:     end,
 1625:     {flags, []} = erlang:trace_info(new, flags),
 1626:     {tracer, []} = erlang:trace_info(new, tracer),
 1627:     ok.
 1628: 
 1629: 
 1630: 
 1631: %% Test that erlang:trace(all, false, ...) works without tracer.
 1632: existing_clear(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1633:     Self = self(),
 1634: 
 1635:     Tracer = proplists:get_value(receiver, Config),
 1636:     N = erlang:trace(existing, true, [send, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1637:     {flags, [send]} = erlang:trace_info(Self, flags),
 1638:     {tracer, Tracer} = erlang:trace_info(Self, tracer),
 1639:     M = erlang:trace(all, false, [all]),
 1640:     io:format("Started trace on ~p processes and stopped on ~p~n", 
 1641:               [N, M]),
 1642:     {flags, []} = erlang:trace_info(Self, flags),
 1643:     {tracer, []} = erlang:trace_info(Self, tracer),
 1644:     M = N, % Used to be N + 1, but from 19.0 the tracer is also traced
 1645: 
 1646:     ok.
 1647: 
 1648: %% Test that erlang:trace/3 can be called on processes where the
 1649: %% tracer has died. OTP-13928
 1650: tracer_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1651:     Proc = spawn_link(fun receiver/0),
 1652: 
 1653:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun receiver/0),
 1654:     timer:sleep(1),
 1655:     N = erlang:trace(existing, true, [send, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1656:     {flags, [send]} = erlang:trace_info(Proc, flags),
 1657:     {tracer, Tracer} = erlang:trace_info(Proc, tracer),
 1658:     unlink(Tracer),
 1659:     exit(Tracer, die),
 1660: 
 1661:     Tracer2 = spawn_link(fun receiver/0),
 1662:     timer:sleep(1),
 1663:     N = erlang:trace(existing, true, [send, {tracer, Tracer2}]),
 1664:     {flags, [send]} = erlang:trace_info(Proc, flags),
 1665:     {tracer, Tracer2} = erlang:trace_info(Proc, tracer),
 1666:     unlink(Tracer2),
 1667:     exit(Tracer2, die),
 1668: 
 1669:     Tracer3 = spawn_link(fun receiver/0),
 1670:     timer:sleep(1),
 1671:     1 = erlang:trace(Proc, true, [send, {tracer, Tracer3}]),
 1672:     {flags, [send]} = erlang:trace_info(Proc, flags),
 1673:     {tracer, Tracer3} = erlang:trace_info(Proc, tracer),
 1674:     unlink(Tracer3),
 1675:     exit(Tracer3, die),
 1676: 
 1677:     ok.
 1678: 
 1679: %% Test that an invalid flag cause badarg
 1680: bad_flag(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1681:     %% A bad flag could deadlock the SMP emulator in erts-5.5
 1682:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:trace(new,
 1683:                                                 true,
 1684:                                                 [not_a_valid_flag])),
 1685: 
 1686:     %% Leaks of {tracer,_} in OTP 23.2
 1687:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1688:     1 = erlang:trace(Pid, true, [{tracer, self()},
 1689:                                  {tracer, self()}]),
 1690:     Pid ! die,
 1691:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} =
 1692:         (catch erlang:trace(new, true, [{tracer, self()}
 1693:                                         | improper])),
 1694:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} =
 1695:         (catch erlang:trace(new, true, [{tracer, self()},
 1696:                                         not_a_valid_flag])),
 1697:     ok.
 1698: 
 1699: %% Test erlang:trace_delivered/1
 1700: trace_delivered(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1701:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1702:     TokLoops = 10000,
 1703:     Go = make_ref(),
 1704:     Parent = self(),
 1705:     Tok = spawn(fun () ->
 1706:                         receive Go -> gone end,
 1707:                         tok_trace_loop(Parent, 0, TokLoops)
 1708:                 end),
 1709:     1 = erlang:trace(Tok, true, [procs]),
 1710:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tok),
 1711:     NoOfTraceMessages = 4*TokLoops + 1,
 1712:     io:format("Expect a total of ~p trace messages~n",
 1713:               [NoOfTraceMessages]),
 1714:     Tok ! Go,
 1715:     NoOfTraceMessages = drop_trace_until_down(Tok, Mon),
 1716:     receive
 1717:         Msg ->
 1718:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Msg})
 1719:     after 1000 ->
 1720:               ok
 1721:     end.
 1722: 
 1723: %% This testcase checks that receive trace works on exit signal messages
 1724: %% when the sender of the exit signal is the process itself.
 1725: trap_exit_self_receive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1726:     Parent = self(),
 1727:     Proc = spawn_link(fun() -> process(Parent) end),
 1728: 
 1729:     1 = erlang:trace(Proc, true, ['receive']),
 1730:     Proc ! {trap_exit_please, true},
 1731:     {trace, Proc, 'receive', {trap_exit_please, true}} = receive_first_trace(),
 1732: 
 1733:     %% Make the process call exit(self(), signal)
 1734:     Reason1 = make_ref(),
 1735:     Proc ! {exit_signal_please, Reason1},
 1736:     {trace, Proc, 'receive', {exit_signal_please, Reason1}} = receive_first_trace(),
 1737:     {trace, Proc, 'receive', {'EXIT', Proc, Reason1}} = receive_first_trace(),
 1738:     receive {Proc, {'EXIT', Proc, Reason1}} -> ok end,
 1739:     receive_nothing(),
 1740: 
 1741:     unlink(Proc),
 1742:     Reason2 = make_ref(),
 1743:     Proc ! {exit_please, Reason2},
 1744:     {trace, Proc, 'receive', {exit_please, Reason2}} = receive_first_trace(),
 1745:     receive_nothing(),
 1746:     ok.
 1747: 
 1748: trace_info_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1749:     catch erlang:trace_info({a,b,c},d),
 1750:     ok.
 1751: 
 1752: %% An incoming suspend monitor down wasn't handled
 1753: %% correct when the local monitor half had been
 1754: %% removed with an emulator crash as result.
 1755: erl_704(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1756:     erl_704_test(100).
 1757: 
 1758: erl_704_test(0) ->
 1759:     ok;
 1760: erl_704_test(N) ->
 1761:     P = spawn(fun () -> receive infinity -> ok end end),
 1762:     erlang:suspend_process(P),
 1763:     exit(P, kill),
 1764:     (catch erlang:resume_process(P)),
 1765:     erl_704_test(N-1).
 1766: 
 1767: ms_excessive_nesting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1768:     MkMSCond = fun (_Fun, N) when N < 0 -> true;
 1769:                    (Fun, N) -> {'or', {'=:=', N, '$1'}, Fun(Fun, N-1)}
 1770:                end,
 1771:     %% Ensure it compiles with substantial but reasonable
 1772:     %% (hmm...) nesting
 1773:     MS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 100)], []}],
 1774:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], MS, trace)]),
 1775:     _ = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, MS, []),
 1776:     %% Now test a match spec using excessive nesting. This
 1777:     %% used to seg-fault the emulator due to recursion
 1778:     %% beyond the end of the C-stack.
 1779:     %%
 1780:     %% We expect to get a system_limit error, but don't
 1781:     %% fail if it compiles (someone must have rewritten
 1782:     %% compilation of match specs to use an explicit
 1783:     %% stack instead of using recursion).
 1784:     ENMS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 1000000)], []}],
 1785:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], ENMS, trace)]),
 1786:     try
 1787:         _ = erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, ENMS, []),
 1788:         {comment, "compiled"}
 1789:     catch
 1790:         error:system_limit ->
 1791:             {comment, "got system_limit"}
 1792:     end.
 1793: 
 1794: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon) ->
 1795:     drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, false, 0, 0).
 1796: 
 1797: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N, D) ->
 1798:     case receive Msg -> Msg end of
 1799:         {trace_delivered, Proc, TDRef} ->
 1800:             io:format("~p trace messages on 'DOWN'~n", [D]),
 1801:             io:format("Got a total of ~p trace messages~n", [N]),
 1802:             N;
 1803:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Proc, _} ->
 1804:             Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(Proc),
 1805:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, Ref, N, N);
 1806:         Trace when is_tuple(Trace),
 1807:                    element(1, Trace) == trace,
 1808:                    element(2, Trace) == Proc ->
 1809:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N+1, D)
 1810:     end.
 1811: 
 1812: tok_trace_loop(_, N, N) ->
 1813:     ok;
 1814: tok_trace_loop(Parent, N, M) ->
 1815:     Name = 'A really stupid name which I will unregister at once',
 1816:     link(Parent),
 1817:     register(Name, self()),
 1818:     unregister(Name),
 1819:     unlink(Parent),
 1820:     tok_trace_loop(Parent, N+1, M).
 1821: 
 1822: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1823: 
 1824: receive_first() ->
 1825:     receive
 1826:         Any -> Any
 1827:     end.
 1828: 
 1829: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1830: 
 1831: receive_first_trace() ->
 1832:     receive
 1833: 	Any when element(1,Any) =:= trace; element(1,Any) =:= trace_ts -> Any
 1834:     end.
 1835: 
 1836: %% Ensures that there is no message in the message queue.
 1837: 
 1838: receive_nothing() ->
 1839:     receive
 1840:         Any ->
 1841:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Any})
 1842:     after 100 ->
 1843: 	    ok
 1844:     end.
 1845: 
 1846: 
 1847: %%% Models for various kinds of processes.
 1848: 
 1849: process(Dest) ->
 1850:     receive
 1851:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 1852:             To ! What,
 1853:             process(Dest);
 1854:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, {M, F, A}} ->
 1855:             Pid = spawn_link(M, F, A),
 1856:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 1857:             process(Dest);
 1858:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, Node, {M, F, A}} ->
 1859:             Pid = spawn_link(Node, M, F, A),
 1860:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 1861:             process(Dest);
 1862:         {link_please, Pid} ->
 1863:             link(Pid),
 1864:             process(Dest);
 1865:         {unlink_please, Pid} ->
 1866:             unlink(Pid),
 1867:             process(Dest);
 1868:         {register_please, Name, Pid} ->
 1869:             register(Name, Pid),
 1870:             process(Dest);
 1871:         {unregister_please, Name} ->
 1872:             unregister(Name),
 1873:             process(Dest);
 1874:         {exit_please, Reason} ->
 1875:             exit(Reason);
 1876:         {exit_signal_please, Reason} ->
 1877:             exit(self(), Reason),
 1878:             process(Dest);
 1879:         {trap_exit_please, State} ->
 1880:             process_flag(trap_exit, State),
 1881:             process(Dest);
 1882:         Other ->
 1883:             Dest ! {self(), Other},
 1884:             process(Dest)
 1885:     after 3000 ->
 1886:               exit(timeout)
 1887:     end.
 1888: 
 1889: 
 1890: %% A smart process template.
 1891: 
 1892: process() ->
 1893:     receive
 1894:         {spawn_please, ReplyTo, Fun} ->
 1895:             Pid = fun_spawn(Fun),
 1896:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, Pid},
 1897:             process();
 1898:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 1899:             To ! What,
 1900:             process();
 1901:         timeout_please ->
 1902:             receive after 1 -> process() end;
 1903:         _Other ->
 1904:             process()
 1905:     end.
 1906: 
 1907: 
 1908: %% Sends messages when ordered to.
 1909: 
 1910: sender() ->
 1911:     receive
 1912:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 1913:             To ! What,
 1914:             sender()
 1915:     end.
 1916: 
 1917: 
 1918: %% Just consumes messages from its message queue.
 1919: 
 1920: receiver() ->
 1921:     receiver(infinity).
 1922: 
 1923: receiver(Timeout) ->
 1924:     receiver(receive
 1925: 		 {set_timeout, NewTimeout} -> NewTimeout;
 1926: 		 _Any -> Timeout
 1927: 	     after Timeout -> infinity  %% reset
 1928: 	     end).
 1929: 
 1930: %% Works as long as it receives CPU time.  Will always be RUNNABLE.
 1931: 
 1932: worker() ->
 1933:     worker(0).
 1934: 
 1935: worker(Number) ->
 1936:     worker(Number+1).
 1937: 
 1938: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 1939:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
 1940: 
 1941: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 1942:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 1943: 
 1944: 
 1945: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine) ->
 1946:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 1947:         0 -> true;
 1948:         RQLen ->
 1949:             erlang:display("Waiting for empty run queue"),
 1950:             MSDL = DeadLine*1000,
 1951:             wait_for_empty_runq(MSDL, MSDL, RQLen)
 1952:     end.
 1953: 
 1954: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, RQLen) when Left =< 0 ->
 1955:     issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen),
 1956:     false;
 1957: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, _RQLen) ->
 1958:     Wait = 10,
 1959:     UntilDeadLine = Left - Wait,
 1960:     receive after Wait -> ok end,
 1961:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 1962:         0 ->
 1963:             erlang:display("Waited for "
 1964:                            ++ integer_to_list(DeadLine
 1965:                                               - UntilDeadLine)
 1966:                            ++ " ms for empty run queue."),
 1967:             true;
 1968:         NewRQLen ->
 1969:             wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine,
 1970:                                 UntilDeadLine,
 1971:                                 NewRQLen)
 1972:     end.
 1973: 
 1974: issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen) ->
 1975:     PIs = lists:foldl(
 1976:             fun (P, Acc) ->
 1977:                     case process_info(P,
 1978:                                       [status,
 1979:                                        initial_call,
 1980:                                        current_function,
 1981:                                        registered_name,
 1982:                                        reductions,
 1983:                                        message_queue_len]) of
 1984:                         [{status, Runnable} | _] = PI when Runnable /= waiting,
 1985:                                                            Runnable /= suspended ->
 1986:                             [[{pid, P} | PI] | Acc];
 1987:                         _ ->
 1988:                             Acc
 1989:                     end
 1990:             end,
 1991:             [],
 1992:             processes()),
 1993:     io:format("WARNING: Unexpected runnable processes in system (waited ~p sec).~n"
 1994:               "         Run queue length: ~p~n"
 1995:               "         Self: ~p~n"
 1996:               "         Processes info: ~p~n",
 1997:               [DeadLine div 1000, RQLen, self(), PIs]),
 1998:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
 1999: 
 2000: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2001:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2002:         ok -> ok;
 2003:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2004:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2005:             Res
 2006:     end.
